sentence: U.S. Rep. Scott Perry has just vanquished one major potential foe in his quest for a 6th term in Congress, as former Pennsylvania Auditor General Eugene DePasquale has decided not to seek a rematch of their 2020 race.
title: Eugene DePasquale will not oppose U.S. Rep. Scott Perry in the 10th Congressional District race

sentence: Amid growing concerns that Beijing has been emboldened by Russian aggression in Ukraine, Republican Rep. Scott Perry insists it is “not too late” for the Biden administration to “show some strength” with regard to China’s ambitions in Taiwan.
title: Internal Debate: Biden Bungled Afghanistan & Ukraine, Is It Too Late For Taiwan?

sentence: The United States must start putting its natural gas and oil onto the market not only to stop funding Russian President Vladimir Putin's war machine but also to help bring down prices and help Americans, Rep. Scott Perry, R-Pa., told Newsmax on Monday.
author: Sandy Fitzgerald
title: Rep. Scott Perry to Newsmax: US Must Produce Oil to Stop Putin, Help Americans

sentence: PONTE VEDRA, Fla. – Republican Rep. Scott Perry, who sits on the House Foreign Affairs Committee, told Fox News Digital that "weakness is provocative," warning that President Biden is not equipped to handle the issues at hand during this "very dangerous and concerning time."
author: Brooke Singman
title: GOP Rep. Scott Perry says 'weakness is provocative,' warns Biden foreign policy 'encourages' adversaries

author: Allahpundit

sentence: Rep. Scott Perry, R-Pa., told Newsmax on Tuesday that President Biden is burning the economy down while “people are scrambling for their lives to try to afford the prices at the pump and across the supply chain spectrum.” During an appearance on “Stinchfield,” the Pennsylvania congressman compared Biden’s record on energy policy to a “pyromaniac that works at the fire company.” “The first thing he did on day one is set the fire by canceling the Keystone [XL] pipeline,” Perry said.
author: Luca Cacciatore
title: Rep. Scott Perry to Newsmax: Biden Is Burning the Economy Down
